ticket.tag: arel2 patch postgresql primary_key rails3.0.3 string
ticket.title: Id is inproperly escaped on postgresql statements when primary key is a string
ticket.original-body:
@@@ ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits [ [0] #<Unit:0xbab77b8> { :id => "00400003", :type => "Unit" } ]
ruby-1.9.2-head > u = Unit.first.subunits.first
#<Unit:0xba96b80> { :id => "00400003", :type => "Unit" }
# Works fine. Generated SQL statement: # Unit Load (1.2ms) SELECT "business_objects".* FROM "business_objects" INNER JOIN "relations" ON "business_objects".id = "relations".child_id WHERE ("business_objects"."type" = 'Unit') AND (("relations".parent_id = '00400002') AND (("relations"."type" = 'Containment'))) AND ("business_objects"."id" = '00400003')
ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits.where(:id => u.id) [#<Unit id: "00400003", type: "Unit>]
# Doesn't work. # Generated SQL statment: # Unit Load (1.2ms) SELECT "business_objects".* FROM "business_objects" INNER JOIN "relations" ON "business_objects".id = "relations".child_id WHERE ("business_objects"."type" = 'Unit') AND (("relations".parent_id = '00400002') AND (("relations"."type" = 'Containment'))) AND ("business_objects"."id" = '''00400003''')
# Notice this part of SQL statment at the end: ("business_objects"."id" = '''00400003''') ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits.where(:id => u) []
@@@
Such queries works fine when primary key is of integer type.
ticket.latest-body:
@@@ ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits [ [0] #<Unit:0xbab77b8> { :id => "00400003", :type => "Unit" } ]
ruby-1.9.2-head > u = Unit.first.subunits.first
#<Unit:0xba96b80> { :id => "00400003", :type => "Unit" }
# Works fine. Generated SQL statement: # Unit Load (1.2ms) SELECT "business_objects".* FROM "business_objects" INNER JOIN "relations" ON "business_objects".id = "relations".child_id WHERE ("business_objects"."type" = 'Unit') AND (("relations".parent_id = '00400002') AND (("relations"."type" = 'Containment'))) AND ("business_objects"."id" = '00400003')
ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits.where(:id => u.id) [#<Unit id: "00400003", type: "Unit>]
# Doesn't work. # Generated SQL statment: # Unit Load (1.2ms) SELECT "business_objects".* FROM "business_objects" INNER JOIN "relations" ON "business_objects".id = "relations".child_id WHERE ("business_objects"."type" = 'Unit') AND (("relations".parent_id = '00400002') AND (("relations"."type" = 'Containment'))) AND ("business_objects"."id" = '''00400003''')
# Notice this part of SQL statment at the end: ("business_objects"."id" = '''00400003''') ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits.where(:id => u) []
@@@
Such queries works fine when primary key is of integer type.
ticket.original-body-html:
ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits
[
    [0] #<Unit:0xbab77b8> {
                 :id => "00400003",
               :type => "Unit"
    }
]


ruby-1.9.2-head > u = Unit.first.subunits.first

#<Unit:0xba96b80> {
             :id => "00400003",
           :type => "Unit"
}


# Works fine. Generated SQL statement:
# Unit Load (1.2ms)  SELECT "business_objects".* FROM "business_objects" INNER JOIN "relations" ON "business_objects".id = "relations".child_id WHERE ("business_objects"."type" = 'Unit') AND (("relations".parent_id = '00400002') AND (("relations"."type" = 'Containment'))) AND ("business_objects"."id" = '00400003')

ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits.where(:id => u.id)
[#<Unit id: "00400003", type: "Unit>]


# Doesn't work. 
# Generated SQL statment:
# Unit Load (1.2ms)  SELECT "business_objects".* FROM "business_objects" INNER JOIN "relations" 
ON "business_objects".id = "relations".child_id WHERE ("business_objects"."type" = 'Unit') 
AND (("relations".parent_id = '00400002') AND (("relations"."type" = 'Containment'))) 
AND ("business_objects"."id" = '''00400003''')

# Notice this part of SQL statment at the end:  ("business_objects"."id" = '''00400003''')
ruby-1.9.2-head > Unit.first.subunits.where(:id => u)
[]

Such queries works fine when primary key is of integer type.

version.tag: arel2 postgresql primary_key rails3.0.3 string
version.title: Id is inproperly escaped on postgresql statements when primary key is a string

version.body: Which version of rails you are using. I am not able to reproduce this problem with rails edge.
version.body-html: Which version of rails you are using. I am not able to reproduce this problem with rails edge.
version.tag: arel2 postgresql primary_key rails3.0.3 string
version.title: Id is inproperly escaped on postgresql statements when primary key is a string

version.body-html: Gem 3.0.3
version.tag: arel2 postgresql primary_key rails3.0.3 string
version.title: Id is inproperly escaped on postgresql statements when primary key is a string

version.body:
With rails edge following is working for me.
@@@ ruby # has_many association create_table :cars, :id => false, :force => true do |t| t.string :id t.string :name t.string :color end create_table :brakes, :id => false, :force => true do |t| t.string :id t.string :name t.string :car_id end
Car.last.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last.id) #=> SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = 'brake_01' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'car_01') => [#<Brake id: "brake_01", name: "b1", car_id: "car_01">] @@@
Can you try your app with rails edge?
version.body-html:
With rails edge following is working for me.

   # has_many association
    create_table :cars, :id => false, :force => true do |t|
      t.string :id
      t.string :name
      t.string :color
    end
    create_table :brakes, :id => false, :force => true do |t|
      t.string :id
      t.string :name
      t.string :car_id
    end


   Car.last.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last.id)
   #=> SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = 'brake_01' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'car_01')
 => [#<Brake id: "brake_01", name: "b1", car_id: "car_01">]

Can you try your app with rails edge?
version.tag: arel2 postgresql primary_key rails3.0.3 string
version.title: Id is inproperly escaped on postgresql statements when primary key is a string

version.body:
This bug says that: @@@ Car.last.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last) @@@ will lead to wrong query, not: @@@ Car.last.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last.id) @@@
Is that what you checked?
I tried your example in 3.0-stable branch. Still failing in the same way:
@@@ ruby-1.9.2-head > c.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last.id) => [#<Brake id: "B", name: nil, car_id: "a">] ruby-1.9.2-head > c.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last) => []
Brake Load (0.5ms) SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = 'B' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'a') Brake Load (0.7ms) SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" ORDER BY brakes.id DESC LIMIT 1 Brake Load (0.5ms) SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = '''B''' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'a')
@@@
I could not try to reproduce it on master due to: @@@ uninitialized constant Rack::Session::Abstract::SessionHash /home/rupert/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-head/bundler/gems/rails-da583df50c32/actionpack/lib/action_dispatch/middleware/session/abstract_store.rb:23:in `<module:Session>' version.body-html:
This bug says that:

Car.last.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last)
will lead to wrong query, not:
Car.last.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last.id)

Is that what you checked?

I tried your example in 3.0-stable branch. Still failing in the same way:

ruby-1.9.2-head > c.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last.id)
 => [#<Brake id: "B", name: nil, car_id: "a">] 
ruby-1.9.2-head > c.brakes.where(:id => Brake.last)
 => [] 

Brake Load (0.5ms)  SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = 'B' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'a')
Brake Load (0.7ms)  SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" ORDER BY brakes.id DESC LIMIT 1
Brake Load (0.5ms)  SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = '''B''' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'a')

I could not try to reproduce it on master due to:

uninitialized constant Rack::Session::Abstract::SessionHash
/home/rupert/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.2-head/bundler/gems/rails-da583df50c32/actionpack/lib/action_dispatch/middleware/session/abstract_store.rb:23:in <module:Session>'

version.tag: arel2 postgresql primary_key rails3.0.3 string
version.title: Id is inproperly escaped on postgresql statements when primary key is a string

version.body:
You are right with just Brake and not Brake.id I am getting following sql in rails edge.
@@@ ruby SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = '''brake_01''' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'car_01') @@@
rails edge requires rack edge.
I created a tool for myself to check code against rails edge. Give it a try https://github.com/neerajdotname/rails_lighthouse .
version.body-html:
You are right with just Brake and not Brake.id I am getting following sql in rails edge.

SELECT "brakes".* FROM "brakes" WHERE "brakes"."id" = '''brake_01''' AND ("brakes".car_id = 'car_01')

rails edge requires rack edge.

I created a tool for myself to check code against rails edge. Give it a try https://github.com/neerajdotname/rails_lighthouse .

version.body:
I found out that there is one more test case failing related to this bug.
Fix and additional test case is available here:
https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/147
This is for master.
I'll also proved a patche for 3.0-stable and I hope that it will be included before 3.0.4 is released.
